meanings.definition: A method of scaling test scores into nine equal intervals.
meanings.sent1: Teachers used stanines to group test scores into nine equal parts.
meanings.sent2: The student's stanine indicated their performance level on the test.
meanings.sent3: The classroom erupted in cheers when the teacher explained stanines with a funny dance.
meanings.sent4: In the world of test scores, stanines act like traffic lights, guiding students on their academic journey.
meanings.sent5: The concept of stanines is like dividing a pizza into nine perfectly equal slices.

meanings.definition: A score on a scale of one to nine representing a specific range of test scores.
meanings.sent1: Her stanine of seven showed she scored in the top range of the test results.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained that a stanine of three meant the student needed improvement.
meanings.sent3: The student proudly displayed his stanine on a banner, declaring himself a test champion.
meanings.sent4: The stanine was like a spotlight, shining on the student's performance for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The stanine was a clear signpost, pointing the way to the student's academic progress.

meanings.definition: To assign a stanine score to a set of test results.
meanings.sent1: Teachers stanined the test results to provide a clear overview of student performance.
meanings.sent2: She will stanine the exams to help students understand their strengths and weaknesses.
meanings.sent3: The principal joked that he could stanine the cafeteria food based on student reviews.
meanings.sent4: The coach stanined the players' performance to identify areas for improvement.
meanings.sent5: He stanines the data meticulously, ensuring accurate and fair assessment of student achievement.
